alert.note: Alert for Culebra (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 18 at 4:13AM AST until January 18 at 2:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 9 to 11 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents continue. * WHERE...Beaches of Culebra. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 2 PM AST this afternoon as swell from the north diminish. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
